extracted_rules.title: Maximum height for main dwelling on a standard lot based on roof slope

Qualifiers.scope: Main dwelling structures on standard lots
applicability: Applies to residential main dwellings located on standard lots
exclusions: Does not apply to main dwellings on substandard or flag lots
Does not apply to accessory structures
notes: Height is measured to the roof peak and, per Figure 42, to the top of roof material

Ambiguity: Figure 42 labels of roof slopes (e.g., 12:14, 12:10) appear inconsistent with Figure 43 definition of rise:run; the threshold condition here is interpreted using rise:run as defined in Figure 43

Variables.name: roof_slope_rise_in
Variables.description: Vertical rise of the roof over the standard run

Variables.name: roof_slope_run_in
Variables.description: Horizontal run used for slope calculation

Variables.name: roof_slope_ratio
Variables.description: Roof slope expressed as rise:run based on 12 in run

Variables.name: height_to_roof_peak_ft
Variables.description: Vertical height measured to the top of roof material at the roof peak

Constants.name: height_measurement_reference
Constants.value: Top of roof material at roof peak

dependencies: Use 12 in run for slope calculation as defined in R5-SLOPE-DEFINITION
Measure height to top of roof material as defined in R6-HEIGHT-MEASURE-REFERENCE

cross_references.subject: Height measurement reference and slope comparison

logical_dependencies: Height limit determination requires roof slope classification against threshold 12:12

extracted_rules.title: Maximum height for main dwelling on a substandard or flag lot

Qualifiers.scope: Main dwelling structures on substandard or flag lots
applicability: Applies to residential main dwellings located on substandard lots
Applies to residential main dwellings located on flag lots
exclusions: Does not apply to standard lots
Does not apply to accessory structures
notes: Height is measured to the roof peak and to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Terms 'substandard lot' and 'flag lot' are referenced but not defined on this page

Variables.name: height_to_roof_peak_ft
Variables.description: Vertical height measured to the top of roof material at the roof peak

Constants.name: height_measurement_reference
Constants.value: Top of roof material at roof peak

Exceptions.statement: Roof slope does not modify the 17 ft maximum for substandard or flag lots

extracted_rules.title: Maximum height for accessory structures in rear or side yard

Qualifiers.scope: Accessory structures located in rear or side yards
applicability: Applies to accessory structures placed within rear yards
Applies to accessory structures placed within side yards
exclusions: Does not explicitly cover accessory structures in front yards
notes: Height measured to the top of roof material per Figure 42
The term 'accessory structure' is not defined on this page

Variables.name: location_in_yard
Variables.description: Yard location of the accessory structure

Variables.name: height_to_roof_peak_ft
Variables.description: Vertical height measured to the top of roof material at the roof peak

Constants.name: height_measurement_reference
Constants.value: Top of roof material at roof peak

Conditions.statement: If location_in_yard ∈ {rear, side}, then height_to_roof_peak_ft <= 12 ft

applicability: Applies to designated second-dwelling/residential accessory dwelling units
exclusions: Does not apply to main dwellings
Does not apply to non-dwelling accessory structures
notes: Height measured to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Term '2nd-dwelling units' is not defined on this page; attachment/detachment status not specified

Variables.name: height_to_roof_peak_ft
Variables.description: Vertical height measured to the top of roof material at the roof peak

Constants.name: height_measurement_reference
Constants.value: Top of roof material at roof peak

extracted_rules.title: Definition and method for determining roof slope

Qualifiers.scope: All roof slope determinations referenced by height regulations on this page
applicability: Applies to calculating roof slope for comparison against thresholds (e.g., 12:12)
notes: Roof slope is defined as the vertical rise in inches per 12 inches of horizontal distance (run)
On drawings, slope may be represented as rise:run (e.g., 6:12)

Ambiguity: The page also shows fraction representations with numbers above/below a line that appear as run over rise (e.g., 12 over 6, then 2 over 1), which conflicts with the stated rise:run convention. For validation, use rise:run with 12 in run.

Variables.name: run_in
Variables.description: Horizontal run; for roof slope determination standardized to 12 inches

steps: Measure rise_in in inches corresponding to that 12 in horizontal run
Use slope_ratio for any threshold comparisons (e.g., against 12:12)

extracted_rules.title: Reference point for measuring building height

Qualifiers.scope: All structures subject to height limits on this page
applicability: Main dwellings on substandard or flag lots
Accessory structures in rear or side yard
notes: Caption in Figure 42 states: 'Height measured to top of roof material'
Interpreted to mean height to roof peak is taken at the top surface of the roof material

Variables.name: height_measurement_point
Variables.description: Physical point at which height is measured
allowed_values: Top of roof material at roof peak

Conditions.statement: All height measurements to roof peak shall be taken to the top of roof material
